citation.article-title: Halomonas halocynthiae sp. nov., isolated from the marine ascidian Halocynthia aurantium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Halomonas halocynthiae sp. nov.
Halomonas halocynthiae (ha.lo.cyn'thi.ae. N.L. gen. n. halocynthiae of Halocynthia aurantium, the ascidian from which the type strain was isolated)
Aerobic, Gram-negative, non-motile, oxidase- and catalase-positive, non-pigmented, encapsulated, nonspore- forming, ovoid cells, 0.6-0.9 μm in diameter.
Able to form fimbria-like structures.
No flagella are observed.
Moderate halophilic.
Sea water or sodium ions are required for growth.
Growth in 0.5-15% (w/v) NaCl with an optimum of 3-6% (w/v) NaCl.
Growth at 7-35 °C with an optimum at 25-28 °C.
No growth at 4, 37 or 40 °C.
Growth at pH 5.0-11.0 with an optimum of pH 7.5-8.5.
Colonies on MA are whitish, circular with an entire margin, convex, 2-3 mm in diameter.

In addition to the physiological properties indicated in Table 1, acid is produced from D-glucose, sucrose, L-arabinose and lactose; Biolog reactions are positive for Tween 40 (weak), methylpyruvate, monomethyl succinate, β-hydroxybutyric acid, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, formic acid, L-lactic acid, propionic acid, succinic acid and bromosuccinic acid.

API 20NE and Biolog substrate reactions are negative for hydrolysis of gelatin, acid production from D-galactose and mannitol, sucrose, chitinase, indole production, arginine dihydrolase, aesculin, L-arabinose, N-acetyl glucosamine, caprate, adipate, malate, phenylacetate, α-cyclodextrin, dextran, glycogen, adonitol, cellobiose, erythritol, D-fructose, L-fucose, D-galactose, m-inositol, D-lactose, D-melibiose, D-raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-glucuronic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, malonic acid, L-alanylglycine, L-asparagine, hydroxy-lproline, L-ornithine, L-phenylalanine, D-serine, dlcarnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, uridine, thymidine, putrescine, glucose 1-phosphate and glucose 6-phosphate.

Resistant to gentamicin (10 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), carbenicillin (25 μg), lincomycin (15 μg), oleandomycin (15 μg), streptomycin (30 μg), neomycin (15 μg), ampicillin (10 μg), erythromycin (30 μg), polymyxin B (300 ED), tetracycline (30 μg) and benzylpenicillin (10 IU).
The major cellular fatty acids are C16:0, C16:1ω7c and C18:1ω9c.
The phospholipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylserine.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 54 mol% (thermal denaturation method).
Isolated from gill tissues of the ascidian Halocynthia aurantium, collected from coastal sea water of the Sea of Japan, Russia.
The type strain is strain KMM 1376T (=DSM 14573T).
